If you in fact need to change any classes, the most likely classes to 
change, extend, or replace are:

AbstractFrontier
\_WorkQueueFrontier
   \_BdbFrontier and associated classes (eg BdbMultipleWorkQueues,etc.)

QueueAssignmentPolicy and its subtypes
CostAssignmentPolicy and its subtypes

In H3:
UriPrecedencePolicy and its subtypes
QueuePrecedencePolicy and its subtypes

The source code itself is the best guide. This is probably the hardest 
part of the crawler to change incrementally. You should spend some time 
understanding the current operation (by reading source code, observing 
the effect of various settings changes, stepping through code in a 
debugger, etc.) before trying any changes. (Once you understand all the 
existing options, you may find you don't need to write any new code.)

- Gordon @ IA

> *Subject:* Re: [archive-crawler] heritrix 1.14.3
>
> How do you want to change the policy? What new/different behavior do you
> need?
>
> A lot of the crawl behavior can be adjusted by settings, rather than
> customizing the code. The frontier classes are among the hardest to
> change incrementally, so if you can get the effect you need via settings
> changes, that's the better approach.
>
> - Gordon @ IA
>
